reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Boscolo during the Monaco Grand Prix weekend. We were very excited about the trip although it ended up being considerably shorter than we planned. Luckily, I had the chance to confirm our reservations while still in the United States. We were prepared when we arrived; come to find out our reservation had been moved to the Park, due to renovations, which incidently seemed to be the same hotel as the Atlantic, at least that's what the taxi cab driver said. It took two days to finally speak to someone to confirm the reservation and make arrangements for our late arrival. So, we paid for an extra evening in order to assure accomodations in a sold out city. Both the location and the hotel staff were great. The room on the other hand looked like someone had squirted ketchup all over the white fabric walls above the bed, I didn't ask and since the bed was clean and we were only staying two days we slept great- the first night. The second night the ampitheater outside our window (looking out through a tree with the ocean in the distance- WoW) played Gwar till 11:00 PM (it may not have even been them- I certainly wouldn't know). The city was wonderful, the food was great, next time I think we are going to stay somewhere else.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: Returned for a second time with my wife to celebrate our wedding anniversary (we got engaged in Nice two years ago whilst staying at the Park). There is a lot to like about this hotel - the exterior is very nice - the more expensive rooms (I have stayed in both a deluxe and a suite) have the most amazing views over the Abert 1er gardens to the sea - you can also see Le Chateau to the left which is beautifully illuminated at night. The location is amazing - very central for the beaches, the Cours Saleya, the Old Town, the Rue Massena, and Avenue Jean Medecin - all are literally minutes from the hotel. The staff are very nice and helpful. The private beach (Rhul Plage) is excellent and is well worth splahing out the 38 euros for a couple if that is your kind of thing on holiday - (beds, parasols, towels, waiter service - expensive but better than the public beaches).

Last time I took breakfast at the hotel - which consisted of the usual fare - but this time opted to pop out to a fabulous boulangerie round the corner every morning (2 euros 20 for 2 croissants and 1 pain au chocolate).
reviews.title: Reasonable stay

reviews.text: The downside of this hotel is really the shabiness of the rooms - they are clean - but very tired - scuffed paintwork -worn fittings etc. But the beds are comfy - and when you have a wonderful balcony with the most amazing views, you don't really care. Any time I spent in my room I was always sitting out on the balcony. So go on - book a deluxe room.

reviews.text: We stayed the week before the Monaco Grand Prix and had a room to the rear with a view over some flat roofs- quite fun actually as there was a young family of sea gulls nested on one roof who kept us entertained! The room was ok without being great, the breakfast was ok, and the staff were very helpful. Location was 100m or so from the sea-front, across a grassed/tree lined area- some friendly tramps lived here on the benches, drunk but friendly, one had a pet rabbit and a pet duck which he described as his family!
